thread.title: GUARD DUTY: David Davis watches on as Lords prepare to inflict second Article 50 defeat
thread.title_full: GUARD DUTY: David Davis watches on as Lords prepare to inflict second Article 50 defeat

title: GUARD DUTY: David Davis watches on as Lords prepare to inflict second Article 50 defeat
text:
Furious Tory peer Lord Forsyth blasts Lords over Brexit 'veto' bid Critics have accused peers of trying to attach a Brexit ‘veto’ to the Article 50 Bill 
Mr Davis observed as peers debated a proposed amendment that would legally require the Government to seek Parliament’s authorisation before Britain to enter a new relationship with the EU or to leave the bloc with no divorce deal. 
Critics have accused peers of trying to attach a Brexit ‘veto’ to the Article 50 Bill. 
It is expected a majority of peers will back the amendment, which would mark a second change to the Government’s Article 50 Bill in the House of Lords. 
Last week, peers voted in favour of an amendment over the rights' of EU nationals currently living in the UK. 
The proposed legislation had previously passed through the House of Commons unamended. Related articles
